case_title: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX vs VENKATESWARA TRADERS
complaint_summary: The Revenue filed an application under section 256(2) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, seeking a direction to the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal to refer specific questions of law to the High Court for opinion.
investigation_summary: The Income-tax Appellate Tribunal reduced the taxable income for the assessment year 1984-85 from Rs. 1,85,000 to Rs. 40,000 and upheld the Commissioner of Income-tax (Appeals)' decision regarding granting of registration.
judgment_summary: The High Court considered the application under section 256(2) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, and issued an order accordingly. The questions of law raised by the Revenue were reviewed.
legal_arguments: Whether the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal was justified in reducing the taxable income for the assessment year 1984-85.
Whether the Tribunal was correct in upholding the Commissioner of Income-tax (Appeals)' decision regarding granting of registration.
key_issues: Reduction of taxable income for assessment year 1984-85
Granting of registration by Commissioner of Income-tax (Appeals)
summary_vector_notes: The case involves an application under section 256(2) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, filed by the Revenue to seek the High Court's opinion on questions of law regarding the reduction of taxable income and granting of registration by the Commissioner of Income-tax (Appeals). The High Court issued an order accordingly.
